alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 21 at 2:47PM EST until December 22 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...South Walton, Coastal Bay and Coastal Gulf Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 1 PM Thursday to 7 AM EST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to between 1.5 ft and 2.5 ft mean higher high water, which will result in minor inundation of areas along the beachfront. At these levels, flooding affects areas near the Panama City Marina as well as beach access points in Panama City Beach. In addition to the coastal flood risk, there is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will be highest around the time of high tide, which is Thursday Evening around 7 pm CT at Panama City Beach. The threat for coastal flooding will end when winds shift offshore by daybreak Friday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
